Q1: This survey should take about 5-10 minutes to complete. Confirm eligibility for the survey by selecting the text below
Q2: In which faculty are you based? - Selected Choice
Q3: Which of the following organisations usually fund your research? Tick all that apply. Alphabetical with UKRI funders grouped. - Selected Choice
Q4: What is your position? - Selected Choice
Q5: Do you use research software?"Research software" is any software you have used in the generation of a result that you expect to appear in a publication. This might be anything from a few-line script to clean some data, to a fully fledged software suite. It includes code you have written yourself and code written by someone else.
Q6: How important is research software to your work?
Q7: Have you developed your own research software?
Q8: How do you rate your software development expertise?
Q9: Do you feel that you have received sufficient training to develop reliable research software?
Q10: Would you be interested in the university helping you commercialise some of your research software?
Q11: Do you feel that your research software is ready to be released or used outside of your group?
Q12: Have you used ARCHIE-WeSt, the University's high-performance computing (HPC) system? - Selected Choice
Q13_1: How confident are you with the following technologies?Pick only one per row. - Version control
Q13_2: How confident are you with the following technologies?Pick only one per row. - Unit/regression testing
Q13_3: How confident are you with the following technologies?Pick only one per row. - Continuous integration
Q13_4: How confident are you with the following technologies?Pick only one per row. - Compilation and linking
Q13_5: How confident are you with the following technologies?Pick only one per row. - Documentation generators
Q14: How would you rate the university's current level of support for your software development needs?
Q15: Have you or someone in your group ever hired a person specifically to develop software?
Q16: Have you ever included costs for software development in a funding proposal?
Q17_1: How suitable would the following models be for your software development needs? - Hire a full-time software developer
Q17_2: How suitable would the following models be for your software development needs? - Recruit a developer from a central Strathclyde pool as needed
Q18: If you wish to enter the prize draw for one of four £50 Amazon vouchers, please enter your valid email address below, otherwise leave blank.
Q19: Free software consultationDependent on demand, we will make available a number of free half-day consultations for you to meet with a Research Software Engineer and discuss any software issues that you are experiencing. If you are interested in this consultation, please provide your email address below and we will follow up to gain a better understanding of the help we could provide. If you are interested in a free consultation, please enter your valid email address below, otherwise leave blank.
Q20: RSE @ Strathclyde mailing list We have a dedicated mailing list to announce the events we organize, and in particular our monthly software engineering clinics (Hacky Hours). If you are interested in keeping in touch with the local community of Research Software Engineers, please provide your email address below.    If you would like to sign up to our RSE mailing list, please enter your valid email address below, otherwise leave blank.
